intro: Sedum daigremontianum var. daigremontianum, commonly known as "The Ice Plant," is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features fleshy, blue-green leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern, which helps it store water efficiently. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow to orange, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its ability to survive in arid conditions makes it a resilient and low-maintenance plant.
